result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason D. Wallner

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:24 AM Defendant Jason D. Wallner appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by Zoom for Jason D. Wallner.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff Dept.  Defendant was served with a copy of the Protective Order on 9/9/2022.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Paul F Reilly September 12, 2022.

Adjustment Number: 22A 034926,
Payable Number: 474440,
Receipt Number: 22R 038049,
Amount: $20.00

Signed protective order
The original document was titled: Signed protective Order
The original history event date is: 09-09-2022

proposed protective order
The original document was titled: Proposed protective Order
The original history event date is: 09-09-2022
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Apply cash bail previously posted and refund the balance to the poster. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. Court orders firearms be turned over the the Waukesha County Sheriff's department within the next two business days, by defendant's father.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:44 PM Defendant Jason D. Wallner in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Jason D. Wallner. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
